description.narrative: The Extractive Industries Technical Advisory Facility (EI-TAF) is a multi-donor trust fund managed by the Oil, Gas and Mining Policy and Operations Division of the World Bank. The EI-TAF facilitates advisory services to resource-rich, developing country governments for capacity building related to extractive industry contract negotiations and associated policy reforms/frameworks. The objective of the EI-TAF is to assist resource-rich, developing countries to structure correctly extractive industry development projects and related policies, thereby reducing the risk of costly or politically difficult remediation at later stages. The expected outcome is to level the playing field between resource-rich, developing countries and resource companies and ensure that the countries benefit from the exploitation of their extractive resources. The total value of the initiative is $4.9 million over 2 years, starting 2011-12.
